image.altText: Missiles flying through a dark sky

props.synopsis: Israel widens its targets in Iran to strike at oil and gas installations, as leaders of both countries vow to intensify their attacks. Follow live.

title.children: Iran, Israel trade fresh waves of missiles as Netanyahu warns worst to come

image.altText: A string of light from a projectile is seen streaking across a cloudy sky over built-up Tel Aviv

props.synopsis: The paranoia inside Iran right now must be overwhelming — if Mossad can pinpoint figures like revolutionary guards commander Hossein Salami and army chief of staff Mohammad Bergheri, it can take out political and religious leaders, too.

title.children: Paranoia must be building in Iran for Israel strike to humiliate it like this

image.altText: Kharg Island gas flare

props.synopsis: Will Australia's economy be impacted by the Israel-Iran missile attacks?

title.children: What will the Israel-Iran missile attacks mean for Australia's economy?

image.altText: A composite image of Melissa Hortman and John Hoffman.

props.synopsis: A manhunt is underway in Minnesota after Democrats Melissa Hortman, who was killed alongside her husband, and John Hoffman were targeted by a suspect posing as a police officer.

title.children: US politicians and spouses shot, two killed, by fake police officer

image.altText: Albanese

props.synopsis: Australia's closest ally is giving a spirited impression of behaving like a cantankerous bear ahead of G7 summit in Canada.

title.children: Albanese shelters with the herd as Trump's grizzlies lash out

image.altText: Protesters hold anti-Donald Trump signs in the streets of Philadelphia.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of Americans are marching through the US's major cities in the largest protest effort against Donald Trump since his re-election in January.

title.children: Largest anti-Trump protests since election flood US streets

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks into a microphone in front of American flags and gold curtains.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will meet with Donald Trump in what the PM says will be a "constructive discussion" on tariffs and the AUKUS submarine pact.

title.children: Albanese to meet Trump at G7 talks in Canada

image.altText: Two bullet holes are seen in a property's window as yellow police tape is strung across the bottom of the frame

props.synopsis: An Australian man is dead in a shooting incident in Bali, local police say, with another injured Australian being treated in hospital.

title.children: Victim's wife details Australian man's death in Bali villa shooting

image.altText: illustration of father and child in the style of Da Vinci's Adam and God

props.synopsis: Some of Australia's largest IVF clinics have passed inaccurate information about children born from sperm donations to their male donors.

title.children: Sperm donor Mark met his biological kids. Then the IVF clinic found a mistake

image.altText: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma holds the mace trophy aloft as he walks around Lord's after the World Test Championship final.

props.synopsis: Across four days at Lord's, Temba Bavuma's team shows history, both distant and recent, can be overcome by a group brimming with talent and resilience.

title.children: South Africa ditches 'chokers' tag to win World Test Championship

image.altText: A composite image of three men in cricket whites.

props.synopsis: South Africa celebrates a long-awaited triumph, Cummins gives hope then burns reviews, and Rabada sends a message to the haters. Here are the quick hits from the World Test Championship final.

title.children: Five quick hits: Cummins's awful reviews and KG's nod to the haters

image.altText: Mature woman drinking water from a bottle while exercising.

props.synopsis: The "silent disease" of osteoporosis is expected to lead to one fracture in Australia every 30 seconds by 2033. We talked to experts about how to keep your bones healthy for as long as possible.

title.children: 'Tsunami of osteoporosis': Why building strong bones needs to start early

image.altText: A truck unloading rubbish at Woodlawn landfill.

props.synopsis: Energy from waste is common around the world, and there are almost a dozen plants now in operation or being proposed across Australia — but with the opportunity comes other problems.

title.children: Australia is set to embrace energy from waste, but should it?

image.altText: People swimming in a gorge.

props.synopsis: The Kimberley is a land defined by its extremes: a wild climate, harsh terrain and remarkable biodiversity. Join Mark Coles Smith as he guides us on a journey through this extraordinary part of the world.

title.children: Journey into the heart of the Kimberley

image.altText: A landscape showing steep rock formations rising up out of hilly bushland.

props.synopsis: When Hyun Park slipped while climbing in the Warrumbungles, her life depended on her 80-year-old mentor and the tactical gymnastics of a 20-hour overnight rescue mission.

title.children: Remarkable 20-hour rescue of climber dangling unconscious 200m up a sheer cliff

image.altText: A blue question mark fridge magnet on a coral background

props.synopsis: Be warned, this spelling test is like no other!

title.children: Word nerd? Grammar guardian? Try your hand at our spelling quiz

image.altText: The royal family appear on Buckingham Palace's balcony and look up towards the sky

props.synopsis: King Charles III wore a black armband at the Trooping the Colour military parade as a mark of respect for the victims of the Air India plane crash.

title.children: Royals unite for Trooping the Colour as King Charles honours Air India victims

image.altText: A woman in traditional Afghan garments, with bright colours and patterns, sits in a closet with additional dresses.

props.synopsis: Refugees are among Australia's most entrepreneurial newcomers. Lida Mangal hopes her garment business elevates the plight women in her country of origin face.

title.children: 'It's resistance': How a former refugee employs Afghan women 11,000km away

image.altText: Qld Police video 3

props.synopsis: Seven NSW men with alleged Middle Eastern bikie gang links have been charged with abducting a Queensland man behind a gambling investment company.

title.children: Police allege NSW bikies threatened to kill man over $2.4m debt

image.altText: public milling about near a tank, parked in washington near the capitol building

props.synopsis: The parade for the US Army's birthday — which coincides with the US president's birthday — is on the same weekend the country will see hundreds of protests on immigration raids.

title.children: Rare military parade coincides with widespread protests over Trump

image.altText: An aerial picture of Point Cook's skyline, with rows and rows of homes and Melbourne's CBD in the background

props.synopsis: A council in one of Melbourne's growing outer corridors is facing criticism for diverting funding away from a region where locals are calling for more basic infrastructure.

title.children: Backlash after Melbourne council redirects funding from growing suburb

image.altText: A petrol bowser with an out of order sign.

props.synopsis: For more than a week, and with no end in sight, customers of Orroroo's only fuel station cannot top up and fear trips to the next bowser about 40 kilometres away if there's an emergency.

title.children: Orroroo's only fuel station runs dry in another blow for mid north town

image.altText: A film crew wearing headphones and looking at monitors sit in a bus.

props.synopsis: The Catalan people were brutally repressed by fascism in Spain. Now a movie about a grassroots triumph is storming through the box office and winning awards. And it's made it to Australia.

title.children: A bus driver takes a stand against fascism in this surprise hit Spanish film

image.altText: Australian swimmer Lani Pallister in the pool raises her hand to acknowledge the crowd after a race.

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister finishes the Australian Swimming Trials in Adelaide on a high with a record-breaking 1500m freestyle, as Australia names a 40-strong team for the world championships.

title.children: Lani Pallister smashes Commonwealth record on final night of swimming trials

image.altText: Ange Green dances with her daughter Annabeth, or AB, at their Dalby home.

props.synopsis: It took Ange Green months to feel connected to her baby girl. She couldn't understand why she fiercely loved her nephews, but didn't yet feel the same way about her own daughter.

title.children: Mum captures moment she first connected with baby with help of Taylor Swift

image.altText: Man holding face mask

props.synopsis: Billions of face masks are dumped into landfill every year and can take hundreds of years to decompose. New research has found a way to upcycle the waste into a high value tech tool.

title.children: Dumped face masks upcycled into valuable tech tool

image.altText: A woman lying on the ground with her eyes closed. She is wearing jeans and a cropped black top and has several tattoos.

props.synopsis: Mothers who planned freebirths that ended in a hospital transfer say they've been "gaslit" or "abandoned" by birth workers and kicked out of group chats meant to support them. The movement is facing increasing criticism for "groupthink" and "extremism".

title.children: 'It was a cult': Mothers seduced by freebirth movement describe trauma and exclusion

image.altText: A collection of Game Boys.

props.synopsis: Not so long ago, old video games and consoles were the kind of thing you found in hard rubbish — or maybe at a garage sale. Now, they're collectibles. Sometimes extremely valuable ones.

title.children: 'Nostalgia-fuelled binge': How the $US2 million retro video game bubble burst

image.altText: a man on security vision walks out of a parking lot

props.synopsis: A former police chief convicted of rape and murder donned a makeshift uniform and walked out of a high security prison — sparking a days-long manhunt across Arkansas's mountain terrain.

title.children: How the 'Devil in the Ozarks' walked out of maximum security prison

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Amid repeated prosecution accusations of murder, deceit and cover-up, there were exchanges about the right time for a "lie down" and errors in the days of the week, as Erin Patterson finished her evidence.

title.children: The moments from Erin Patterson's evidence that didn't make headlines

image.altText: A distraught man puts his face in his hands as someone nearby puts an arm on his shoulder and other offers a bottle of water.

props.synopsis: Surviving a mass disaster like the Air India crash may be hailed as a kind of "miracle". But what is it like to survive – especially as the only one?

title.children: Just one man survived the Air India crash. He's likely to have many questions

image.altText: A man wearing an orange cap and black t-shirt stands in a park while holding green balloons with a rainbow in the background.

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer has finished his 250th Parkrun — a milestone he set after he was diagnosed with terminal brain cancer.

title.children: Professor Richard Scolyer celebrates milestone set after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Sheep and ram bones on the ground

props.synopsis: The farming town of Orroroo, in South Australia's mid north, is a microcosm of the drought plaguing swathes of Australia. What is its future in a changing climate?

title.children: In one town, the impact of climate change is starkly felt by the next generation
